item.title: Brecknock Road & Leighton Grove Pothole, 2nd September
item.description:
This pothole is on the corner of Brecknock Road and Leighton Grove. It’s on the road near Willbury House, Hilldrop Estate. When buses and large vehicles drive on it the flats in N7 0DA shake. The entire building shakes like a mini earthquake until the vehicle drives on. This occurs multiples times every hour and countless times a day. The family in the flat below me has a baby and it’s scary for them. Any help here would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 111, Brecknock Road, Archway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car left in same spot for 24 months, moves for MOT only., 2nd September
item.description:
Car left in same place all year round only moving for MOT. Council workers are unable to tend to grass and bushes now growing in the road again. The car makes the street look untidy and is rotting in the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Annandale Road, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised blocking of parking on road causing issues and safety concerns, 2nd September
item.description:
I wish to formally raise a complaint regarding persistent obstruction and misuse of public parking spaces on Queens Passage, which has been occurring since at least September 2024. This issue is caused by a company believed to be Skd Mobile Tyres, operating from Queens Passage. The company frequently blocks access to both the unmade section of the road and now the permitted parking bays directly outside my home. They regularly place barriers, buckets filled with bricks or nails, and misleading signage claiming a skip is due, though no skip ever arrives. These actions create hazards for both pedestrians and vehicles. Company staff have openly admitted to using these obstructions to reserve space for their vehicles or to ensure their vans can exit freely. Residents have repeatedly witnessed the company’s vehicles occupying these spaces for extended periods, preventing legitimate use by those with paid permits. This misuse of public space is not only unfair to residents who pay for parking but also poses an ongoing safety risk. We request urgent investigation and enforcement action to restore fair and safe access to these public parking areas.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queens Passage, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 2nd September
item.description:
Disgusting show of graffiti on a busy footpath for all family and school children who use it as a route regularly. Believed to be homophonic and racial slur from what was being shouted as we approaching. Lovely new and maintained lane which has been tarnished. Robin Hood lane just before the gates when coming from the mini roundabout. Has been there a day, hoping the council can still clear before it’s too late.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Robin Hood Lane, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet
